resources.string: Method overloading happens when we have two functions named the same but they have different parameters passed in.
This allows us to use the same name but have different variations of the block of code.

To overload a method we change it\'s signature by changing the amount or type of parameters passed in. If the name and the parameters are the same for both functions, the method will not be overloaded.
public void playCard(Card card) \npublic void playCard(Card card, int handSize)

Create two methods with the same name: convertToCentimeters. The first method has one parameter of type int, which represents the entire height in inches. You\'ll convert inches to centimeters, in this method, and pass back the number of centimeters, as a double. The second method has two parameters of type int, one to represent height in feet, and one to represent the remaining height in inches.
*Enter a number to see the result in centimeters.
